summary: This is an email chain from June 22, 2020, discussing the imminent arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell. The FBI New York office indicates they are in the process of charging her and planning an arrest, possibly moving it up from August to within the next few weeks. The email also mentions the need for follow-up travel for interviews after her arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the email chain; the FBI states they are in the process of charging her and planning her arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in a question from 'The DD' asking about the status of his case and what remains to be done.

connections.description: Maxwell is discussed in the context of the Epstein investigation, indicating her alleged involvement.

events.title: FBI plans Maxwell arrest
events.description: The FBI New York office emails that they are in the process of charging Ghislaine Maxwell and planning her arrest, possibly moving it up from August to within the next few weeks.

events.title: Conference call with SDNY
events.description: The FBI mentions having a conference call with the Southern District of New York (SDNY) to discuss moving up Maxwell's arrest timeline.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell as of June 22, 2020.
The arrest timeline was being moved up from an initial August target to potentially within the next few weeks.
The FBI anticipated needing to travel to conduct follow-up interviews after Maxwell's arrest.
A senior official ('The DD') inquired about the status of the Jeffrey Epstein case and what remained to be done.
